### Deploying Plugin which wraps `Census` Sample: End-to-End Machine Learning Workload and maintaining it with CI/CD

Mary Christmas! :christmas_tree:

*In these days we wish to analyze the census data of the people to create a more
perfect union, between Humanity and Eden. [:pill:](https://pdxjohnny.github.io/redpill/)*

- Upstream
  - https://github.com/oneapi-src/oneAPI-samples/blob/cd3a63b84e9a93799c6d8d715daa500f2e629087/AI-and-Analytics/End-to-end-Workloads/Census/README.md
- Overlay
  - MIT:https://github.com/oneapi-src/oneAPI-samples/blob/master/License.txt
  - Scripted deployment on devcloud
  - Create ad-hoc python package using `dffml service dev` for output of example
  - Deploy package packaged again as container image to devcloud container registry
- Orchestrator
  - DevCloud
- Proposed downstream overlays
  - Usage of `dffml-model-daal4py`
  - Alice please contribute CI/CD to 2nd party split out `dffm-model-daal4py`

The `Census` sample code illustrates how to use Intel® Distribution of Modin* for ETL operations and ridge regression algorithm from the Intel® Extension for Scikit-learn* library to build and run an end-to-end machine learning (ML) workload.

```console
source activate tensorflow
python TensorFlow_HelloWorld.py
```

- https://asciinema.org/a/543517
- Okay you have to export the IPython notebook, gonna run with testbook, executed lickty split this time.
- https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/main/tests/docs/test_notebooks.py
- https://asciinema.org/a/543520

```console
; cat > census.sh <'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
set -x

source /opt/intel/inteloneapi/setvars.sh  > /dev/null 2>&1
source activate tensorflow

#  1 Install the Intel® Distribution of Modin* python environment.
conda create -y -n intel-aikit-modin intel-aikit-modin -c intel
#  2 Activate the Conda environment.
conda activate intel-aikit-modin
#  3 Install Jupyter Notebook.
conda install nb_conda_kernels
#  4 Install OpenCensus.
pip install opencensus testbook ipykernel
#  5 Run the Census Sample
python -c 'import sys; from testbook import testbook; testbook(sys.argv[1], execute=True).__enter__()' census_modin.ipynb
EOF
; qsub -l nodes=1:gpu:ppn=2 -d . census.sh
```

- Frequent network failures, executing census.sh while the notebook it executes downloads.

```python
------------------
#import pandas as pd
import modin.pandas as pd

import modin.config as cfg
from packaging import version
import modin

cfg.IsExperimental.put("True")
cfg.Engine.put('native')
# Since modin 0.12.0 OmniSci engine activation process slightly changed
if version.parse(modin.__version__) <= version.parse('0.11.3'):
    cfg.Backend.put('omnisci')
else:
    cfg.StorageFormat.put('omnisci')
````

## Ephemeral GitHub Actions Runner on DevCloud

[![asciicast](https://asciinema.org/a/543546.svg)](https://asciinema.org/a/543546)

```console
; watch -d -n 1 qstat -n -1
; cat github-actions-runner.sh 
#!/bin/bash
# Note: If you have not already done so, set up your CLI environment by sourcing  the setvars script in the root of your oneAPI installation.
# Linux*:
#  • For system wide installations: . /opt/intel/oneapi/setvars.sh
#  • For private installations:  . ~/intel/oneapi/setvars.sh
#  • For non-POSIX shells, like csh, use the following command: bash -c 'source <install-dir>/setvars.sh ; exec csh'
# For more information on configuring environment variables, see Use the setvars Script with Linux* or macOS*
# (https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/develop/documentation/oneapi-programming-guide/top/oneapi-development-environment-setup/use-the-setvars-script-with-linux-or-macos.html).

set -x
#etset -eEuo pipefail


OWNER=pdxjohnny
REPO=pdxjohnny.infra.devcloud.github.actions.runners
# gh repo create --public pdxjohnny.infra.devcloud.github.actions.runners
TOKEN=github_pat_1123123123123123123


tar xzf ./actions-runner-linux-x64-*.tar.gz

bash -x bin/installdependencies.sh

TOKEN=$(curl -s -X POST -H "authorization: token ${TOKEN}" "https://api.github.com/repos/${OWNER}/${REPO}/actions/runners/registration-token" | jq -r .token)

cleanup() {
  ./config.sh remove --token "${TOKEN}"
}

./config.sh \
  --url "https://github.com/${OWNER}/${REPO}" \
  --token "${TOKEN}" \
  --name "${NAME}" \
  --unattended \
  --ephemeral \
  --work _work

./runsvc.sh

cleanup
; qsub -l nodes=1:gpu:ppn=2 -d . github-actions-runner.sh
; qstat -f 2077005
```

**github-actions-runner.sh**

```bash
set -eEuo pipefail

NAME="devcloud.$(hostname).$RANDOM"
OWNER=pdxjohnny
REPO=pdxjohnny.infra.devcloud.github.actions.runners
# gh repo create --public pdxjohnny.infra.devcloud.github.actions.runners
export TOKEN=ghp_kojUFZ5pA7AL6fJzOLQ5dqQu4LDMpV2123217w


tar xzf ./actions-runner-linux-x64-*.tar.gz

bash -x bin/installdependencies.sh

TOKEN=$(curl -s -X POST -H "authorization: token ${TOKEN}" "https://api.github.com/repos/${OWNER}/${REPO}/actions/runners/registration-token" | python -c 'import sys, json; print(json.loads(sys.stdin.read())["token"])')

cleanup() {
  ./config.sh remove --token "${TOKEN}"
}

./config.sh \
  --url "https://github.com/${OWNER}/${REPO}" \
  --token "${TOKEN}" \
  --name "${NAME}" \
  --unattended \
  --ephemeral \
  --work _work

./run.sh

cleanup
```

## 2023-01-04 @pdxjohnny Engineering Logs

We got the container build for the py39 working yesterday. Today we will try to spin DevCloud runners and validate the plugins using the container image we built yesterday `https://registry.digitalocean.com/dffml/dffml:main`.

Eventually we can upstream the POC webhook service into DevCloud if this works.

- References
  - https://docs.github.com/en/actions/hosting-your-own-runners/autoscaling-with-self-hosted-runners#using-webhooks-for-autoscaling
  - https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhooks/securing-your-webhooks
  - https://docs.github.com/en/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhooks/receiving-webhooks-with-the-github-cli
    - Comment to be added to the beta
      - https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/38261#discussioncomment-4595006
      - > 2023-01-11: You can now forward webhooks via the GitHub CLI. Thanks for registering your interest to join the beta program for webhook forwarding in the GitHub CLI. We're excited to say that you've been added to the beta, and you can try webhook forwarding today! To get started, head over to the ["Receiving webhooks with the GitHub CLI"](https://docs.github.com/developers/webhooks-and-events/webhooks/receiving-webhooks-with-the-github-cli) page in the GitHub Docs.
  - https://github.com/pdxjohnny/httptest

### Architecture

**TODO** how will devcloud add the runners? It will need a valid GitHub PAT for the project... this might be a "work with GitHub" moment to look more at their APIs. They are not setup for this at all. Could the "add runner" endpoint could be modified to use a verifiable presentation?

**TODO** sequence diagram

```mermaid
graph TD
    subgraph devcloud
      qsub[Queue Ephemeral Runner Job]
    end
    subgraph webhook_service
      create_secret
      ssh_devcloud_dmz
    end
    subgraph GitHub
      subgraph workflow_needing_devcloud[Workflow in need of DevCloud Infra]
        run_tests
      end
      subgraph bootstrap[Auxiliary/Secondary Bootstrap Workflow]
        oidc
        add_webhook -->|Required before primary| run_tests
      end
    end

    oidc -->|Check if repo/org needs account provisioned| create_secret
    create_secret -->|JWT as secret?| add_webhook

    run_tests -->|Triggered, send workflow_run| ssh_devcloud_dmz

    ssh_devcloud_dmz --> qsub
    qsub -->|Run workflow| run_tests
```

### Testing

```python
import unittest
import subprocess
import urllib.request

import httptest

class TestHTTPServer(httptest.Handler):

    def do_GET(self):
        contents = "what up".encode()
        self.send_response(200)
        self.send_header("Content-type", "text/plain")
        self.send_header("Content-length", len(contents))
        self.end_headers()
        self.wfile.write(contents)

def main():
    with httptest.Server(TestHTTPServer) as ts:
        proc = subprocess.Popen(
            *("gh webhook forward --repo=pdxjohnny/pdxjohnny.infra.devcloud.github.actions.runners --events=workflow_job --url=" + ts.url()).split()
        )
        proc.stop()

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
```
